page.title: 20THE OLD BAKERY.
page.content: The Old Bakery is situated in Parsonage Lane,Durley.It is now two dwelling places but used to be two bakeries.One was built just over one hundred years ago,the other was built around 1912 and carried on trading until about 15 years ago. Around the time of the Second World War a loaf cost about 4.5 old pence, which is just over one new penny.A loaf in 1985 costs about 38 new pence. The Bakery used about 800 pounds of flour each day.Brown and white bread was baked but more white bread was sold.Cakes were also made daily. The bread was taken out of the ovens by a peel which is about one meter long with a flat bladed scoop on the end.The ovens were heated by burning faggots which are bundles of sticks tied tightly together. The bakery is now called Hedgerows End
